org.svvrl.goal.core.logic.qptl

Class QPTLUnifier

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.svvrl.goal.core.logic.LogicUnifier<QPTL>
      • org.svvrl.goal.core.logic.qptl.QPTLUnifier

  • public class QPTLUnifier
extends LogicUnifier<QPTL>
    A QPTLUnifier can perform unification on two QPTL formulae: source and target. If the unification succeeds (the source and the target are equal up to proposition substitution), then there exists a proposition substitution for the source such that the substituted source is equal to the target.
    Author:
    Ming-Hsien Tsai

      Performs unification on two formulae: source and target, and returns a proposition substitution for source such that the substituted source is equal to target.

    • Constructor Detail

      • QPTLUnifier

        public QPTLUnifier()
        Constructs this unifier. By default, a proposition may be mapped by more than one proposition in the returned substitution of unification for lunify(QPTL, QPTL), lunifyStr(QPTL, QPTL), punify(QPTL, QPTL), and punifyStr(QPTL, QPTL)

      • QPTLUnifier

        public QPTLUnifier(boolean one_to_one)
        Constructs this unifier.
        Parameters:
        one_to_one - indicating if a proposition can be mapped by only one proposition in the returned substitution of unification for lunify(QPTL, QPTL), lunifyStr(QPTL, QPTL), punify(QPTL, QPTL), and punifyStr(QPTL, QPTL)

    • Method Detail

      • unify

        public java.util.Map<Proposition,QPTL> unify(QPTL source,
                                             QPTL target)
                                      throws UnificationException
        Description copied from class: LogicUnifier
        Performs unification on two formulae: source and target, and returns a proposition substitution for source such that the substituted source is equal to target.
        Specified by:
        unify in class LogicUnifier<QPTL>
        Parameters:
        source - a formula
        target - a formula
        Returns:
        a proposition substitution that renames propositions in source such that the renamed source is equal to target
        Throws:
        UnificationException - if the unification fails

      • lunify

        public java.util.Map<Proposition,QPTL> lunify(QPTL source,
                                              QPTL target)
                                       throws UnificationException
        Unifies two formulae up to literal renaming.
        Parameters:
        source - a QPTL formula
        target - a QPTL formula
        Returns:
        a proposition substitution that renames propositions in source such that the renamed source is equal to target
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if source or target contains a sub-formula which is a conjunction or disjunction of more than 16 formulae
        UnificationException - if the unification fails

        Unifies two QPTL formulae.
        Parameters:
        source - the source formula, which may be incomplete
        target - the target formula
        Returns:
        substitution obtained from this unification
        Throws:
        UnificationException - if f and g have different binary operator or the unification fails
